495/5000  The Family Emergency Income (IFE) is established for informal workers and monotributistas, between 18 and 65 years old, with the highest degree of vulnerability, who in mid-April will collect $ 10,000 one-time, although it could be repeated in May if circumstances so require. merit.    The IFE joins the package of measures already in place that reach formal workers in the critical, informal, monotributistas, retired, pensioners, allowance beneficiaries and companies sectors.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603182807/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/covid-19-el-gobierno-implementara-el-ingreso-familiar-de-emergencia-ife-para-aliviar-la

The services of electrical energy, running water, gas through networks, fixed and mobile telephony and Internet and cable television may not be suspended due to non-payment (up to 3 consecutive or alternate bills) during a period of 180 calendar days (from 25 March to September 21, 2020).  This measure includes both the MSMEs described in Resolution 173/2020, Worker Cooperatives or Recovered Companies registered in INAES and Public Entities that contribute to the preparation and distribution of food in the framework of the food emergency; as well as to the residential users detailed in Decree 311/2020, including monotributistas enrolled in a category whose annualized monthly income does not exceed 2 times the Minimum Vital and Mobile Salary.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200603182118/https://www.latinfinance.com/daily-briefs/2020/5/7/argentina-says-there-s-time-to-reach-a-debt-restructuring-deal    Webpage back-archived from previous note, but a copy of the page from 21st April 2020:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200421114329/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/produccion/medidas-pymes-covid

26 April  National Government extends provisions of Decree 297/2020 until May 10, 2020. With the new decree, provinces are allowed to “flexibilize” the isolation and gradually open sectors of the economy if they consider it is necessary to do it. The Governors of the Provinces may decide exceptions to said isolation and to the prohibition of circulating personnel. affected to certain activities and services in certain Departments and Parties of its jurisdiction, whenever the requirements demanded by the national sanitary authority are verified.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200620154857/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/228261/20200426

National Government extends social, preventive and compulsory isolation until May 10, 2020. IMPORTANT!!! With this new decree, provinces are allowed to make more flexible the isolation and gradually open sectors of the economy if they consider it is necessary to do it. Responses from provinces have been different, ranging from very strict (Córdoba) to more permissive (Buenos Aires). Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200429181240/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/

Vulnerable families with a child will receive a bonus of 4000 pesos; and those who have two or more children, will receive an extraordinary reinforcement of 6000 pesos. The objective is to guarantee access to food for the most vulnerable sectors in the context of the emergency caused by Covid-19.

In order to mitigate the impact that the new coronavirus pandemic generates in the country in economic matters and to guarantee essential services for the development of daily life in the context of the health emergency, the National Government has arranged to extend until 30 June including the suspension of the application of fines and the closing and disabling of bank accounts due to the rejection of checks due to lack of funds. It also extends until May 31 the obligation on the part of the companies that provide mobile telephony or the Internet to guarantee a reduced service that guarantees connectivity, as established by the regulations (prohibition of outage).  /web/20200507032129/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/228496/20200501

Vulnerable families with a child receive a bonus of 4000 pesos. Those who have two or more children receive an extraordinary reinforcement of 6000 pesos. This cash transfer is given through "Tarjeta Alimentar" to buy food and basic supplies. 12 May  Buenos Aires city authorities began allowing some "non-essential" shops and businesses to reopen on Tuesday 12 May, easing coronavirus restrictions in place in the Argentine capital since March 20. The government of President Alberto Fernandez has said a nationwide quarantine will remain in place until May 24, but it allowed businesses to reopen in some areas of the country as part of a gradual resumption of economic activity. Bookstores, florists and perfumeries reopened in Buenos Aires. Stores were required to limit the number of customers and allocate entry according to identity card numbers. Cafes and restaurants are also allowed to reopen from Tuesday, but only for take-away orders.  http://archive.vn/lMI6M
Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200513093448/https://en.unesco.org/covid19/educationresponse

5th June    The Government of Argentina has announced that the national quarantine that began on March 20 has been extended through June 28, with greater restrictions in the greater Buenos Aires area under DNU 297/2020. President Alberto Fernández on Thursday night announced the extension of Argentina's mandatory lockdown in selected large cities, especially Buenos Aires and its surroundings, until June 28.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200611100938/https://www.batimes.com.ar/news/argentina/lockdown-extended-until-june-28-with-two-types-of-quarantine.phtml    Regional variations remain in place: “Considering that the epidemiological situation is not homogeneous within the national territory, the administration of isolation will adopt a modality that contemplates the reality of the various jurisdictions of the country.  Provincial and local authorities may request exceptions to isolation from personnel affected by certain activities and services” Source:   https://web.archive.org/web/20200620154857/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/228261/20200426    https://web.archive.org/web/20200622180219/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200614231327/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/medidas-gobierno

5 June- 28 June  Quarantine extended to 28th June, restrictions can ease in some places.  Fernández said the lockdown had been a success to date, highlighting that in 18 of Argentina’s 24 regions (23 provinces and Buenos Aires City)  "there is no community circulation" of the virus. Measures in these areas would become increasingly flexible with many businesses and activities allowed to restart.  Only massive gatherings, sporting or musical shows and events, and any type of grouping would be banned, he added.  http://archive.vn/70lKQ    https://web.archive.org/web/20200622180219/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/    https://web.archive.org/web/20200614231327/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/medidas-gobierno

"Likewise, specific protocols are designed, disseminated and implemented for Long-Term Residences and for the care and social life of the elderly in particular, in absolute observance of the protocols of the Ministry of Health.    In addition, biosafety supplies are distributed , instructive for their correct use, training is provided for essential direct assistance personnel, gerontological workshops are developed weekly via zoom with the dissertation of experts from around the world who provide us with their knowledge and experiences by convening by meeting a number of 500 on-line attendees from all over the country and the world, between officials and authorities interested in the subject to direct assistance health personnel in residences. 26th June    Announcement that from July 1 "we're going to ask everyone to return to isolation in the greater Buenos Aires area at home and to only leave to fetch provisions for daily life," he said. The measure will last until July 17 with "only essential services and some industrial zones" remaining operational.       This indicates that previously non-essential businesses had been open (as indicated in the note for 12 May)    http://archive.vn/TTPpj

27 June  Transport remains extremely restricted.  The Ministry of Transportation halted all Argentine intercity domestic buses, trains, and flights in March, and most of these services remain suspended due to the ongoing quarantine order.  In the Buenos Aires metropolitan area, passengers can only board public transportation if there is an available seat (standing room passengers are forbidden). These regulations are likely to remain in place for the duration of the quarantine order. Travelers should expect further travel disruptions with little notice.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200622180219/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

27 June  Transport remains extremely restricted.  The Ministry of Transportation halted all Argentine intercity domestic buses, trains, and flights in March, and most of these services remain suspended due to the ongoing quarantine order.       The government of Argentina has implemented additional travel restrictions to limit the spread of COVID-19. Only travelers with confirmed international flight reservations may travel from the provinces to the Buenos Aires metro area 24 hours in advance of the flight, and traveling overland or by ground transportation requires information to be provided to the Government of Argentina. There are checkpoints throughout Argentina.       https://web.archive.org/web/20200622180219/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

27 June    Argentina’s borders remain closed to foreign nationals and non-residents entering the country.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200627102118/https://www.gov.uk/foreign-travel-advice/argentina

The Province and the City of Buenos Aires entered a new stage of the coronavirus quarantine on July 1st. Only essential activities, such as supermarkets, warehouses and drug stores, are allowed to open.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200702135639/https://www.clarin.com/ciudades/nueva-cuarentena-tenes-saber-restricciones-9-preguntas_0_z6yX4gsbP.html

Workers in activities called essential or excepted by the National Government, who have to move around the Metropolitan Area of Buenos Aires (AMBA), must have a circulation permit to do so. Going out to exercise is also forbidden.     https://web.archive.org/web/20200702135639/https://www.clarin.com/ciudades/nueva-cuarentena-tenes-saber-restricciones-9-preguntas_0_z6yX4gsbP.html

A new lockdown phase has been announced by the National Government, aiming to start a progressive rollback of the most stringent measures. This new phase has started on 17 July and is expected to go until 2 August.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200730155338/https://www.casarosada.gob.ar/slider-principal/46976-coronavirus-el-presidente-anuncio-una-apertura-escalonada-de-las-actividades-entre-el-18-de-julio-y-el-2-de-agosto

The National Government has announced a new lockdown phase, aiming to start a progressive rollback of the most stringent measures. This new phase has started on 20 July and is expected to take place until 2 August.    Policy changes regarding workplace closing:  * As of July 20, local shops can re-open. Food and drink establishments can also re-open, but only for takeaways.    * From Wednesday, July 22, local clothing and footwear shops can re-open. Places of worship can also open for administrative tasks, online celebrations, and individual prayer, but with capacity limits and social distancing measures in place.    * From Wednesday, July 29, hairdressers and salons can re-open.     * As of Monday, August, 3, local businesses in high footfall areas may re-open, including clothing and footwear stores. This does not include Liniers, Retiro and Constitución, and Calle Avellaneda and Once.    Link from official source:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200730161234/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/232234/20200718    Links from media coverage:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200730160705/https://www.lanacion.com.ar/politica/coronavirus-argentina-punto-punto-medidas-anunciadas-alberto-nid2399090    https://web.archive.org/web/20200730160836/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/361251/argentina-authorities-ease-covid-19-restrictions-in-buenos-aires-metropolitan-area-from-july-20-update-21

Despite the new lockdown phase starting on 20 July, only essential workers are allowed to use public transport.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200730161234/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/232234/20200718

Restrictions will remain in place on what day citizens can leave their homes, depending on their national identity card numbers (those ending in even numbers leave on even days, odd numbers on odd days etc.)    From Tuesday, July 21, children will be allowed to socialize for a maximum of one hour per day between 10:00 and 18:00 on Tuesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays, and Sundays. Children will be allowed only within 500 metres of their homes, and all children over the age of six are to follow social distancing guidelines and wear face masks. Public squares and parks will also re-open temporarily for the purposes of exercise and to enable the use of playgrounds.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200730162842/https://www.infobae.com/coronavirus/2020/05/15/paseo-de-chicos-en-la-ciudad-de-buenos-aires-todo-lo-que-hay-que-saber-para-el-primer-dia/

The President Alberto Fernandez announced on Friday, August 14, that the lockdown in Argentina was extended until Aug. 30 meaning that restrictions in an around capital city Buenos Aires will continue. The measures, which are more relaxed in less densely populated areas, had been scheduled to expire on Sunday, August 16.    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822183258/https://www.usnews.com/news/world/articles/2020-08-14/argentina-sticks-with-covid-19-lockdown-focused-in-and-around-buenos-aires

"That, therefore, it is advisable to maintain the prohibition established by Decree No. 520/20, regarding certain activities and practices that are specifically stated and prohibited, some for the "DISPO" and others for the "ASPO", and, likewise, maintain among said prohibitions, as provided by Decree No. 641/20, the holding of social or family events in closed spaces and in all cases, even with less than TEN (10) PEOPLE, as indicated in articles 9 and 18 of this decree, with the scope and exceptions stipulated therein. In this sense, the Chief of the Cabinet of Ministers, at the request of the Governors or Governors, may authorize the holding of social or family gatherings in the places reached by the “DISPO” measure, according to the epidemiological and sanitary risk assessment of the place. But in no case may it grant exceptions to said prohibition in the places reached by the ASPO." (Google translation of an excerpt of the last Presidencial order).    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822154552/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/233684/20200816?busqueda=3

"Limited public transportation within cities with strict limitations is operating. Intercity transport is mostly suspended.  Masks are required nationwide. Transport remains extremely restricted.  The Ministry of Transportation halted all Argentine intercity domestic buses, trains, and flights in March, and most of these services remain suspended due to the ongoing quarantine order.  In the Buenos Aires metropolitan area, only essential workers with a circulation permit may board public transportation. These regulations are likely to remain in place for the duration of the quarantine order."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822151447/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"The Government of Argentine has announced the extension of quarantine and social distancing measures. The following areas will remain in quarantine (“aislamiento social”) through at least August 30: the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area; the Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, and San Pedro departments of Jujuy; the Güer Aike department of Santa Cruz; the Río Grande department of Tierra del Fuego; the Capital and Chamical departments of La Rioja; the General José de San Martin department of Salta; and the Capital and Banda departments of Santiago del Estero.  Per the latest order, most of the rest of the country remains in mandatory social distancing.  Even in those provinces under mandatory social distancing, strict limits on travel, gatherings, and other activities apply."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20200822151447/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

Is public transportation operating? Yes.  - Limited public transportation within cities with strict limitations is operating. Intercity transport is mostly suspended.    - Transport remains extremely restricted.  The Ministry of Transportation halted all Argentine intercity domestic buses, trains, and flights in March, and most of these services remain suspended due to the ongoing quarantine order.  - In the Buenos Aires metropolitan area, only essential workers with a circulation permit may board public transportation. These regulations are likely to remain in place for the duration of the quarantine order.

The Government of Argentina has announced the extension of quarantine and social distancing measures. The following areas will remain in quarantine (“aislamiento social”) through at least October 11: the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area; in addition to those places forming part of the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area, the departments of General Pueyrredón, Bahía Blanca, and Tandil in Buenos Aires Province; the Manuel Belgrano, Ledesma, El Carmen, Palpalá, Susques, Yavi, Rinconada, and San Pedro departments of Jujuy; the Capital department of La Rioja; the Bariloche and Dina Huapi metropolitan areas and the General Roca department of Río Negro; the General José de San Martín, Cerrillos, Rosario de Lerma, General Güemes, La Caldera, Orán, and Capital departments of Salta; the Río Gallegos metropolitan area in Santa Cruz; the Capital and Banda departments of Santiago del Estero; and the Río Grande department of Tierra del Fuego. Per the latest order, most of the rest of the country remains in mandatory social distancing. Even in those provinces under mandatory social distancing, strict limits on travel, gatherings, and other activities apply. Media reports indicate that this period may be extended with some modifications; this has yet to be confirmed.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201009214732/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

Travel between cities, departments, and provinces is restricted.    The government of Argentina has implemented additional travel restrictions to limit the spread of COVID-19. Only travelers with confirmed international flight reservations may travel from the provinces to the Buenos Aires metro area 24 hours in advance of the flight.    Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201009214732/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

Per the latest Argentine government policy, any foreigner who is not a resident in Argentina will not be permitted to enter Argentina.     Link: https://web.archive.org/web/20201009214732/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

From October 25 to November 8, some provinces will be under ASPO (Aislamiento social, preventivo y obligatorio = Social, Preventive and Compulsory Isolation) and some others will be under DISPO (Distanciamiento Social, Preventivo y Obligatorio = Social, preventive and mandatory distancing). Under DISPO, internal movement is allowed.    Provinces under ASPO: City of Buenos Aires, Buenos Aires, Chaco, Chubut, Córdoba, La Rioja, Mendoza, Neuquén, Río Negro, Salta, San Luis, Santa Cruz, Santa Fe, Santiago del Estero, Tierra del Fuego and Tucumán.    Provinces under DISPO: Misiones, Corrientes, Formosa, Entre Ríos, Catamarca, Jujuy, La Pampa and San Juan.     Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20201028220922/https://argentina.as.com/argentina/2020/10/25/actualidad/1603627708_473148.html

Protocol triggered by symptomatic case:  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/detectar

Close contact  Anyone who has provided care to a confirmed case while the case had symptoms or within 48 hours prior to the onset of symptoms and who has not used appropriate personal protective measures.  Anyone who has stayed at a distance of less than 2 meters with a confirmed case while the case had symptoms, or for 48 hours prior to the onset of symptoms for at least 15 minutes.  Anyone sharing a room, bathroom or kitchen with confirmed cases of COVID-19.  Anyone who attends community centres (dining room, club, parish, street stopers, etc.) and has maintained close proximity to a confirmed case, while the case had symptoms (less than 2 meters, for 15 minutes).  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/detectar

"Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes.  Travel between cities, departments, and provinces is restricted. Additional information about movement exemptions can be found here  (In Spanish). Individual provinces may require additional local permits to enter or transit.  The government of Argentina has implemented additional travel restrictions to limit the spread of COVID-19. Only travelers with confirmed international flight reservations may travel from the provinces to the Buenos Aires metro area 24 hours in advance of the flight. U.S. Citizens intending to depart Argentina should carefully review and understand the documentary requirements in the “Departing Argentina,” and “Travel to Buenos Aires,” sections of this page (below) before planning their travel."  https://web.archive.org/web/20201116171330/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Argentine authorities are implementing a “tourism pilot program” for citizens and residents of bordering countries traveling to the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area for tourism.  This program does not apply to the United States.  In addition to the sworn statement required of all passengers entering Argentina, persons entering under this pilot program must also present a negative COVID-19 PCR test within the 72 hours before travel and proof of medical insurance for COVID-19 that covers hospitalization or isolation for the duration of their stay in Argentina. Travelers under the program  must enter Argentina at Ministro Pistarini Ezeiza International Airport, San Fernando International Airport, or the Buquebus Ferry Terminal in Buenos Aires.  As Argentine authorities are still finalizing the details of this pilot program, persons who believe they meet its requirements should contact Argentine immigration directly."  https://web.archive.org/web/20201116171330/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

These regulations are likely to remain in place for the duration of the quarantine order. Travelers should expect further travel disruptions with little notice. Most of the country is either in quarantine or mandatory social distancing, and in both instances, public events are prohibited. Specifically, for those regions in quarantine, specifically  the metropolitan areas of Bariloche and Dina Huapi in Río Negro Province; and the department of Puerto Deseado in Santa Cruz Province, until December 20, the citizens are only allowed to leave their house for essential services. For regions in mandatory social distancing, events with 20 or more people in closed spaces and public outdoor events with more than 100 people are forbidden.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/distanciamiento/actividades/prohibidas

"Per the latest Argentine government policy, most foreigners who are not a resident in Argentina, including U.S. citizens, will not be permitted to enter Argentina; the U.S. Embassy is not aware of an estimated end date for this travel ban.    On November 28, the Government of Argentina announced that foreign citizens,  with direct relatives who are Argentine citizens, may enter Argentina for a temporary visit under exceptional circumstances if certain conditions are met.Entry under this program is restricted to the following ports of entry: Ministro Pistarini Ezeiza International Airport, San Fernando International Airport, Buquebus Ferry Terminal; and the land border crossings of Paso de los Libres – Uruguayana, Sistema Cristo Redentor, San Sebastián, and Gualeguaychú – Fray Bentos.  In addition, travelers seeking entry under this program must present:  a birth certificate, marriage certificate, or legal documentation of common law marriage or partnership (with required apostille)  as evidence of the direct relation with the Argentine citizen.  Travelers are also required to present a copy of the National ID Card (DNI) of the Argentine relative, return travel reservation/tickets, negative COVID-19 PCR test taken within 72 hours before travel, and evidence of medical travel insurance that includes hospitalization and quarantine coverage for COVID-19.  The traveler must also present at the port of entry a letter of request that provides the necessary reason for the visit, dates of entry and departure to and from Argentina, address where the traveler will stay, and any additional relevant information required for the immigration official to evaluate the request."    Further, "Argentine authorities have implemented a 'tourism pilot program' for citizens and residents of bordering countries traveling to the Buenos Aires Metropolitan Area for tourism."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

" With the priority objective of assisting and containing vulnerable sectors of the citizenry and the inescapable purpose of guaranteeing essential rights, the National Government establishes an increase in the income ranges of the family group and the amounts of family allowances of 7.50%. The regulations comply with the provisions of Law 24,714, which stipulates the corresponding variations and exceptions." Most of the country is either in quarantine or mandatory social distancing, and in both instances, public events are prohibited. Specifically, for those regions in quarantine, specifically  the metropolitan areas of Bariloche and Dina Huapi in Río Negro Province, and the department of Puerto Deseado in Santa Cruz Province, until December 20, the citizens are only allowed to leave their house for essential services. For regions in mandatory social distancing, events with 20 or more people in closed spaces and public outdoor events with more than 100 people are forbidden.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/distanciamiento/actividades/prohibidas

For those regions in quarantine (e.g. the metropolitan areas of Bariloche and Dina Huapi in Rio Negro Province and the department of Puerto Deseado in Santa Cruz Province until December 20), the citizens must remain in their homes, only leaving for essentials such as food, medicine, and cleaning supplies.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Is public transportation operating? Yes.    Limited public transportation within cities with strict limitations is operating.   In the Buenos Aires metropolitan area, only essential workers with a circulation permit may board public transportation. These regulations are likely to remain in place for the duration of the quarantine order. Travelers should expect further travel disruptions with little notice.  Long-haul intercity transportation options are restricted to essential workers as outlined in the national quarantine order as well as those seeking medical treatment.  The Government of Argentina has also indicated that U.S. citizens may use these transportation options to connect with confirmed international departure opportunities from Buenos Aires.  All passengers are required to have a valid Certificado Único de Circulación to travel and should consult transportation provider and local officials regarding travel eligibility and additional requirements."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Per the latest Argentine government policy, most foreigners who are not a resident in Argentina, including U.S. citizens, will not be permitted to enter Argentina; the U.S. Embassy is not aware of an estimated end date for this travel ban.    On November 28, the Government of Argentina announced that foreign citizens,  with direct relatives who are Argentine citizens, may enter Argentina for a temporary visit under exceptional circumstances if certain conditions are met.Entry under this program is restricted to the following ports of entry: Ministro Pistarini Ezeiza International Airport, San Fernando International Airport, Buquebus Ferry Terminal; and the land border crossings of Paso de los Libres – Uruguayana, Sistema Cristo Redentor, San Sebastián, and Gualeguaychú – Fray Bentos.  In addition, travelers seeking entry under this program must present:  a birth certificate, marriage certificate, or legal documentation of common law marriage or partnership (with required apostille)  as evidence of the direct relation with the Argentine citizen.  Travelers are also required to present a copy of the National ID Card (DNI) of the Argentine relative, return travel reservation/tickets, negative COVID-19 PCR test taken within 72 hours before travel, and evidence of medical travel insurance that includes hospitalization and quarantine coverage for COVID-19.  The traveler must also present at the port of entry a letter of request that provides the necessary reason for the visit, dates of entry and departure to and from Argentina, address where the traveler will stay, and any additional relevant information required for the immigration official to evaluate the request." A:    Argentines will be vaccinated with the Russian Sputnik V coronavirus vaccine beginning on Tuesday 29 December.    "The doses of the Sputnik V vaccine that arrived from Russia will be available in each province and on Tuesday Dec. 29 at 9 am the simultaneous vaccination will begin throughout the country," President Alberto Fernandez said Sunday in a tweet.    Argentine medical workers began receiving the vaccine and officials insisted it was safe. President Alberto Fernández called it the largest vaccination campaign in the country’s modern history.    The vaccine  will be free and voluntary.      https://web.archive.org/web/20210104125537/https://www.aa.com.tr/en/americas/argentina-covid-19-vaccinations-with-sputnik-v-start/2090879    https://web.archive.org/web/20210104125657/https://apnews.com/article/belarus-coronavirus-pandemic-latin-america-auto-racing-glance-russia-fcddcc286f8295421c0ff301c242dad0

"Tomorrow (January 16, 2021) the 300,000 doses will arrive with the second component so that health personnel can complete the two-dose scheme," added the official who commented that the distribution operation throughout the country will be similar to the first time based on the joint with all jurisdictions."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111182006/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-107542-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-covid-19-en-el-pais  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115190146/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-200759-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-la-covid-19-en-argentina

Schools remain closed for now, but they are gearing up for children to come back face to face safely for the 2021 school year. Since March 20, 2020, "the workers achieved by the "preventive and compulsory social isolation" should not attend their place of work. When their tasks or other similar tasks can be carried out from the place of isolation, they must establish with their employer, within the framework of good contractual faith, the conditions for carrying them out."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento/aclaraciones  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/coronavirus-reglamentacion-de-temas-laborales-del-decreto-presidencial

Most of the country is either in quarantine or mandatory social distancing, and in both instances, public events are prohibited. Specifically, for those regions in quarantine, the citizens are only allowed to leave their house for essential services. For regions in mandatory social distancing, events with 20 or more people in closed spaces and public outdoor events with more than 100 people are forbidden.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/distanciamiento/actividades/prohibidas  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento/aclaraciones

For those regions in quarantine, the citizens must remain in their homes, only leaving for essentials such as food, medicine, and cleaning supplies.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Is public transportation operating? Yes.    Limited public transportation within cities with strict limitations is operating.   In the Buenos Aires metropolitan area, only essential workers with a circulation permit may board public transportation. These regulations are likely to remain in place for the duration of the quarantine order. Travelers should expect further travel disruptions with little notice.    Long-haul intercity transportation options are restricted to essential workers as outlined in the national quarantine order as well as those seeking medical treatment.  The Government of Argentina has also indicated that U.S. citizens may use these transportation options to connect with confirmed international departure opportunities from Buenos Aires.  All passengers are required to have a valid Certificado Único de Circulación to travel and should consult transportation provider and local officials regarding travel eligibility and additional requirements."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

For those regions in quarantine, the citizens must remain in their homes, only leaving for essentials such as food, medicine, and cleaning supplies.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes.    Travel between cities, departments, and provinces is restricted. Additional information about movement exemptions can be found here  (In Spanish). Individual provinces may require additional local permits to enter or transit."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Per the latest Argentine government policy, most foreigners who are not a resident in Argentina, including U.S. citizens, will not be permitted to enter Argentina; the U.S. Embassy is not aware of an estimated end date for this travel ban."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

" With the priority objective of assisting and containing vulnerable sectors of the citizenry and the inescapable purpose of guaranteeing essential rights, the National Government establishes an increase in the income ranges of the family group and the amounts of family allowances of 7.50%. The regulations comply with the provisions of Law 24,714, which stipulates the corresponding variations and exceptions." (Google translation)    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/234428/20200902 (in Spanish)

"Rent amounts and mortgage loans are frozen. Until January 31, 2021, the monthly amount that was paid in March of this year must be paid. The provision includes UVA credits."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/economia/medidas-economicas-COVID19/alquileres
Coordinated public information campaign via this website:     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/salud/coronavirus-COVID-19

Schools in certain areas are still closed for now, such as within Catamarca and La Rioja, but they are gearing up for children to come back face to face safely for the 2021 school year.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/el-nuevo-calendario-2021-preve-como-ordenador-las-clases-presenciales-y-consolida-la

Since March 20, 2020, "the workers achieved by the "preventive and compulsory social isolation" should not attend their place of work. When their tasks or other similar tasks can be carried out from the place of isolation, they must establish with their employer, within the framework of good contractual faith, the conditions for carrying them out."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento/aclaraciones  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/coronavirus-reglamentacion-de-temas-laborales-del-decreto-presidencial

Most of the country is either in quarantine or mandatory social distancing, and in both instances, public events are prohibited. Specifically, for those regions in quarantine, the citizens are only allowed to leave their house for essential services. For regions in mandatory social distancing, events with 20 or more people in closed spaces and public outdoor events with more than 100 people are forbidden.    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/distanciamiento/actividades/prohibidas  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento/aclaraciones

For those regions in quarantine, the citizens must remain in their homes, only leaving for essentials such as food, medicine, and cleaning supplies.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Is public transportation operating? Yes.  Limited public transportation within cities with strict limitations is operating.   In the Buenos Aires metropolitan area, only essential workers with a circulation permit may board public transportation. These regulations are likely to remain in place for the duration of the quarantine order. Travelers should expect further travel disruptions with little notice.  Long-haul intercity transportation options are restricted to essential workers as outlined in the national quarantine order as well as those seeking medical treatment.  The Government of Argentina has also indicated that U.S. citizens may use these transportation options to connect with confirmed international departure opportunities from Buenos Aires.  All passengers are required to have a valid Certificado Único de Circulación to travel and should consult transportation provider and local officials regarding travel eligibility and additional requirements."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

For those regions in quarantine, the citizens must remain in their homes, only leaving for essentials such as food, medicine, and cleaning supplies.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/aislamiento  https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Are there restrictions on intercity or interstate travel? Yes.    Travel between cities, departments, and provinces is restricted. Additional information about movement exemptions can be found here  (In Spanish). Individual provinces may require additional local permits to enter or transit."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

"Per the latest Argentine government policy, most foreigners who are not a resident in Argentina, including U.S. citizens, will not be permitted to enter Argentina; the U.S. Embassy is not aware of an estimated end date for this travel ban."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://ar.usembassy.gov/covid-19/

" With the priority objective of assisting and containing vulnerable sectors of the citizenry and the inescapable purpose of guaranteeing essential rights, the National Government establishes an increase in the income ranges of the family group and the amounts of family allowances of 7.50%. The regulations comply with the provisions of Law 24,714, which stipulates the corresponding variations and exceptions." (Google translation)    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.boletinoficial.gob.ar/detalleAviso/primera/234428/20200902 (in Spanish)

"Electricity services, running water, gas through networks, fixed and mobile telephony and Internet and cable television may not be suspended for non-payment (up to 3 consecutive or alternate bills) for a period of 180 days."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/economia/medidas-economicas-COVID19/corteservicios
Coordinated public information campaign via this website:     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/salud/coronavirus-COVID-19

Testing for those who are suspected, and "the test that is carried out is the PCR, with a special circuit to have the result as soon as possible and thus be able to confirm or rule out."    https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/coronavirus/detectar

AC:  "The Ministry of Health of the Nation reports that as of today the jurisdictions reported the application of 107,542 of the 300,000 doses distributed of the Sputnik V vaccine. In this first stage, the vaccine is intended for health personnel between 18 and 59 years of age, from intensive care units and microbiology laboratories of health institutions located in large urban agglomerates where the pandemic has had a greater impact."    "It should be noted that the vaccines are provided by the National State and the vaccination plan is carried out in stages, free of charge, voluntarily and regardless of the history of having suffered from coronavirus."    "Tomorrow (January 16, 2021) the 300,000 doses will arrive with the second component so that health personnel can complete the two-dose scheme," added the official who commented that the distribution operation throughout the country will be similar to the first time based on the joint with all jurisdictions."    "Said González García. And he added: 'This first stage we do the vaccination to protect those who have to take care of us, which are health workers, starting with the most exposed; but on Monday (February 22, 2021) they start with those over 70 years old and then we will reach everyone the entrerrianos, working together. '"    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111182006/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-107542-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-covid-19-en-el-pais  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115190146/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-200759-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-la-covid-19-en-argentina  https://web.archive.org/web/20210218223803/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/gonzalez-garcia-superviso-el-plan-de-vacunacion-contra-la-covid-19-en-entre-rios

The Ministry of Health released a recommendation to elderly people to double down on their efforts to minimize their exposure to COVID-19 by following social-distancing guidelines.     https://web.archive.org/web/*/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/recomendaciones-para-los-mayores-de-60-anos-y-personas-con-comorbilidades

AC:  "The Ministry of Health of the Nation reports that as of today the jurisdictions reported the application of 107,542 of the 300,000 doses distributed of the Sputnik V vaccine. In this first stage, the vaccine is intended for health personnel between 18 and 59 years of age, from intensive care units and microbiology laboratories of health institutions located in large urban agglomerates where the pandemic has had a greater impact."    "It should be noted that the vaccines are provided by the National State and the vaccination plan is carried out in stages, free of charge, voluntarily and regardless of the history of having suffered from coronavirus."    "Tomorrow (January 16, 2021) the 300,000 doses will arrive with the second component so that health personnel can complete the two-dose scheme," added the official who commented that the distribution operation throughout the country will be similar to the first time based on the joint with all jurisdictions."    "Said González García. '"    "The Minister of Health, Carla Vizzotti, and the Minister of Education, Nicolás Trotta, held a virtual meeting this afternoon in which they evaluated the implementation of the vaccination of teachers and non-teaching education workers throughout the country from the arrival of a million doses of Sinopharm vaccines.    Vizzotti, who is isolated due to having been diagnosed with COVID-19, highlighted that “23 of the 24 jurisdictions are already planning between today (March 3, 2021) and tomorrow (March 4, 2021) the start of the vaccination of teachers according to their strategic plan, joining the rest of the groups that continue to be inoculated, and it is great news ”."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111182006/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-107542-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-covid-19-en-el-pais  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115190146/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-200759-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-la-covid-19-en-argentina  https://web.archive.org/web/20210218223803/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/gonzalez-garcia-superviso-el-plan-de-vacunacion-contra-la-covid-19-en-entre-rios  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308163559/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/los-ministerios-de-salud-y-de-educacion-analizaron-el-inicio-de-la-campana-de-vacunacion-de

"Tomorrow (January 16, 2021) the 300,000 doses will arrive with the second component so that health personnel can complete the two-dose scheme," added the official who commented that the distribution operation throughout the country will be similar to the first time based on the joint with all jurisdictions."    "Said González García. And he added: 'This first stage we do the vaccination to protect those who have to take care of us, which are health workers, starting with the most exposed; but on Monday (February 22, 2021) they start with those over 70 years old and then we will reach everyone the entrerrianos, working together. '"    "The Minister of Health, Carla Vizzotti, and the Minister of Education, Nicolás Trotta, held a virtual meeting this afternoon in which they evaluated the implementation of the vaccination of teachers and non-teaching education workers throughout the country from the arrival of a million doses of Sinopharm vaccines.    Vizzotti, who is isolated due to having been diagnosed with COVID-19, highlighted that “23 of the 24 jurisdictions are already planning between today (March 3, 2021) and tomorrow (March 4, 2021) the start of the vaccination of teachers according to their strategic plan, joining the rest of the groups that continue to be inoculated, and it is great news ”."    "The Minister of Health of the Nation, Carla Vizzotti, participated today (March 5, 2021) in a virtual way in the vaccination operation against COVID-19 to members of the security forces who carry out tasks in the front line since the beginning of the pandemic, in which they were Present the Minister of National Security, Sabina Frederic and Chiefs of the Federal Security Forces."    https://web.archive.org/web/20210111182006/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-107542-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-covid-19-en-el-pais  https://web.archive.org/web/20210115190146/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/ya-se-aplicaron-200759-dosis-de-la-vacuna-contra-la-covid-19-en-argentina  https://web.archive.org/web/20210218223803/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/gonzalez-garcia-superviso-el-plan-de-vacunacion-contra-la-covid-19-en-entre-rios  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308163559/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/los-ministerios-de-salud-y-de-educacion-analizaron-el-inicio-de-la-campana-de-vacunacion-de  https://web.archive.org/web/20210308163837/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/noticias/vizzotti-y-frederic-participaron-de-operativo-de-vacunacion-miembros-de-las-fuerzas-de

Argentina’s borders are closed to non-resident foreign nationals. Some exceptions apply to this rule. Exemptions may be granted by the Argentine Migrations Office, such as for non-resident essential workers, family members of Argentine nationals or residents and sportspersons.

Companies falling within the sectors detailed in Annex I of Resolution 198/2021 can request the benefit .    The amount of assistance varies according to the sector in which the company carries out its activities:    Non-critical affected: up to $ 9,000;  Critical: up to $ 12,000 (for temporary provision will be $ 18,000);  Health sector: up to $ 18,000.  https://web.archive.org/web/20210503132030/https://www.argentina.gob.ar/trabajo/repro2

From thereon out communicates daily on preventative measures, hence coded as 2G; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607161958/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2884086568319607&set=a.771480979580187  https://web.archive.org/web/20200607162003/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2884086571652940&set=a.771480979580187  https://web.archive.org/web/20200607162010/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2884086611652936&set=a.771480979580187  https://web.archive.org/web/20200607162017/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2884086654986265&set=a.771480979580187  https://web.archive.org/web/20200607162019/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2884086664986264&set=a.771480979580187  https://web.archive.org/web/20200607162416/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2884086748319589&set=a.771480979580187  https://web.archive.org/web/20200607162414/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2884086714986259&set=a.771480979580187

Photos from the Bhutan health ministry indicate the presence of public information posters at the airport, later posts also show similar postes in public areas; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607163801/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2899164650145132&set=a.999012646827018; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607163735/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2899164700145127&set=a.999012646827018

Bhutan Ministry of Health confirms that they "have secured our entry-points with health screening programs." on February 3. Pictures from February 2nd show the screening, so coded as start date. https://web.archive.org/web/20200607155436/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2682748185171201&set=a.630832867029420; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607155010/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2680793982033288&set=a.630832867029420

FAQ from the Ministry of Health clearly indicates that symptomatic cases with a travel history to China within the last 14 days should consult with their doctor ( #6 in the source) and that Bhutan is able to PCR test those cases (#1 in the Preparedness and Response section). Hence, this is coded as 1.; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607164434/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2920457071349223&set=a.999012646827018

First case of Covid confirmed in Bhutan. As a result, "Conforming with the response plan, the government announces closure of schools and institutes in Thimphu, Paro and Punakha for two weeks with effect from March 6."  Prime Minister's Facebook announcement:  https://web.archive.org/web/20200517104244/https://www.facebook.com/PMOBhutan/posts/2750933261686026

As the first case of Covid is confirmed, "all mass gatherings must be deferred until further directives".  [https://web.archive.org/web/20200517105725/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/travel_not.jpeg]
The government imposes a two weeks restriction on all incoming tourists   https://www.drukair.com.sg/news/covid-19-updates-bhutan-travel-announcement/
Bhutan launches Coronavirus hotline; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607161751/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2975368735858056&set=a.771480979580187

MoH advises the general public not to rush to the hospital if you do not have close contact with the confirmed case of COVID-19 ("You might expose yourself to the risk of infection. You are not a close contact if you haven’t spent 15 minutes within 1 meter range with the confirmed case"). https://web.archive.org/web/20200607153330/http://www.moh.gov.bt/announcementcovid-19/

Contact tracing of the 76-year-old corona positive patient from the US was immediately set in place (on March 6), covering his itinerary including places visited and people he had associated with. https://web.archive.org/web/20200607153628/http://www.moh.gov.bt/third-batch-of-17-people-tested-negative/; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607153633/https://www.drukair.com.sg/news/covid-19-updates-bhutan-travel-announcement/

"Update: The government would like to inform that all schools in Wangduephodrang Dzongkhag and Phuentsholing Thromde will remain closed from March 9 to 15."  This is still not all the schools in the country closed, only certain regions, so still a targeted policy.  [https://web.archive.org/web/20200517105147/https://www.facebook.com/PMOBhutan/photos/a.410118499100859/2754032238042795/?type=3&theater=]

On March 11, the Ministry of Health (unlike in previous statements) recommended wearing a mask not only when a Covid infection is suspected or when caring for vulnerable individuals but "if you happen to go to a crowded place."    Hence, rated as 1G.    https://web.archive.org/web/20201017120403if_/https://www.facebook.com/MoHBhutan/posts/2986288851432711
Lab test still requires eligibility as per FB post of MoH; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607165221/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=2988085191253077&set=a.999012646827018

The Prime Minister announced that all schools and educational institutes across the country will remain closed from 18 March. https://web.archive.org/web/20200528105143/http://www.bbs.bt/news/?p=129835

From 23 March, Bhutan closed all its land borders.   https://web.archive.org/web/20200514155402/https://www.mfa.gov.bt/?p=7747  Note: Travelers by road from India are major source of footfall into the country.    Prior to this, Bhutan had already banned entry to all foreigners for 14 days from 7 March. This has been extended ever since. This along with the closure of all international borders meant that only travel that was allowed was for repatriation purposes through embassies in respective countries. While there is no explicit formal suspension of flights, all the reports seem to suggest that flights have stopped accepting travellers from around 12 March. Hence listing it as a 4.    https://web.archive.org/web/20200611165649/https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kolkata/bhutan-shuts-doors-on-foreigners-1200-tourists-cross-over-to-bengal/articleshow/74520180.cms  https://web.archive.org/web/20200611170118/https://www.dw.com/en/how-bhutan-wrote-its-coronavirus-success-story/a-53760136  https://web.archive.org/web/20200611170210/https://indianexpress.com/article/lifestyle/coronavirus-outbreak-bhutan-here-is-how-the-country-is-tackling-the-virus-6309240/  https://web.archive.org/web/20200611170805/https://www.bbs.bt/news/?p=130765

The Ministry of Health has been advising people to stay home from March 26:   https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=3019565828105013&set=a.2978655832196013; https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=3019565911438338&set=a.2978655832196013

While the government of Bhutan recommended staying home for everyone from March 26, there is no evidence that elderly people were singled out to stay at home beforehand. Moreover, the announcement of the stay-at-home-recommendations makes no mention of senior citizens.  In order to not cross-pollute indicators, H8 will stay at 0.

All movie theatres, snooker rooms and video parlours should be closed. Agencies (Civil service, corporate, private, and other agencies) will have to devise and institute “work from home” system; All business entities must adjust timing and engage employees in a way that there is no crowding.[https://web.archive.org/web/20200330033435/https://www.mfa.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/press-release-1.pdf]

On March 27th, Bhutan banned all public gatherings.    Source 1  https://web.archive.org/web/20200715155453/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-03/27/c_138923859.htm    Source 2    https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19
Gathering at any social events like birthday, wedding or promotion are disallowed. [https://web.archive.org/web/20200330033435/https://www.mfa.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/press-release-1.pdf]

Road Safety and Transport Authority is instructed to design and implement strategies for passengers using public transports to maintain physical distance. [https://web.archive.org/web/20200330033435/https://www.mfa.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/press-release-1.pdf]

All non-essential and leisure travels within the country are restricted. Movements in groups, within the towns and communities are also discouraged. [https://web.archive.org/web/20200330033435/https://www.mfa.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/03/press-release-1.pdf]

On April 1st, the Health Ministry met with " representatives of the Royal Society for Senior Citizens," stating the following after: As of now a nationwide linelisting of all the elderly population is ongoing. By the end of next week we will know exactly which person is in which gewog with what health condition.  While the senior-specific hotline 6060 was also launched around Apr 1st, this is not sufficient to rise to a level 1 and therefore remains at 0 for the time being.   https://www.facebook.com/MoHBhutan/photos/a.771480979580187/3033474600047469/?type=3
While Bhutan rolled out more extensive rapid testing, PCR tests are still limited.

The Druk Gyalpo’s Relief Kidu has granted Nu. 150 million as the first disbursement of the Relief Kidu to 13,006 people. The Relief Kidu will be at Nu. 12,000 per person per month for recipients of the full amount of the Kidu and Nu. 8,000 per month for recipients of the partial amount of the Kidu. Additional support of Nu.800 per child per month will be granted to eligible beneficiaries with children. The Kidu will be provided for three months – April, May and June 2020 https://web.archive.org/web/20200607175705/https://www.royalkidu.bt/press-release/index.html

The Royal Monetary Authority (RMA) is working with the financial institutions to defer the loan repayment period and waive interest payments for three months. https://web.archive.org/web/20200607175452/https://www.royalkidu.bt/royal-address/index.html

Ministry of health specifies PCR-test criteria including anyone symptomatic at flu clinics and hospitals as well as in quarantine centers; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607174703/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=3070214253040170&set=a.999012646827018
Schools still closed. [https://web.archive.org/web/20200517110732/https://southasiamonitor.org/education-culture/bhutan-considering-several-options-school-closure]
Schools still closed. [https://web.archive.org/web/20200517111224/http://www.xinhuanet.com/english/2020-05/11/c_139048272.htm]
Schools likely to reopen next month  https://web.archive.org/web/20200523163840/http://southasiamonitor.org/bhutan/government-prepares-reopen-schools

Bhutan government expands testing policy on May 18th to also include periodic testing of high risk communities. While not a 3, this certainly qualifies as a significant expansion in PCR testing policy and is therefore upgraded to 2; https://web.archive.org/web/20200607170538/https://www.facebook.com/photo?fbid=3137691029625825&set=a.999012646827018

On May 21st, the Bhutan government published the first "Guidance on Prevention & Control of COVID-19 in Elderly People"  to prevent the spread of COVID-19 infection to the elderly people (60 years and above). The guidance includes recommendations to health care workers to periodically conduct medical check-ups on all elderly people (~18% of the population of Bhutan) at home and to discourage "All elderly people [...] from visiting health facilities, unless it is an emergency or if they have regular appointments like Dialysis, Chemotherapy etc.." It also lists a number of recommendations to the elderly itself as well as to caregivers. As those recommendations include "staying home," "hygiene," and "visitor restrictions," this qualifies as a 1G.    https://web.archive.org/web/20210129193925/http://www.moh.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/ict-files/2020/05/Guidance-on-Prevention-Control-of-COVID-19-in-Elderly-People-1st-edition-1.docx

There seems to be no change in border policies. However, with the resumption of domestic air travel in India from May 25th and train services from June 1st, repatriation of Bhutanese nationals seems to have increased. Although it is not a clear case, still listing it as a 4 as official policy hasn't changed.  https://web.archive.org/web/20200611184020/https://www.imf.org/en/Topics/imf-and-covid19/Policy-Responses-to-COVID-19 https://web.archive.org/web/20200611184358/https://www.facebook.com/MoHBhutan/

"Ministry of Health strongly recommends everyone to wear face masks; however, individuals must abide by the protocol for using (and disposing) face masks which is being constantly advocated by MOH through its social media handles and other media platforms."    http://web.archive.org/web/20200907211220if_/https://www.facebook.com/MoHBhutan/posts/updateministry-of-health-strongly-recommends-everyone-to-wear-face-masks-however/3185053628222898/

No indication that the border has opened.   It appears that it may be allowing transfers from Singapore, but there is not evidence that they are allowed to actually enter the official borders and leave the airport.   http://archive.vn/wip/lTvox   http://archive.fo/w5uDihttps://web.archive.org/web/20200627215840/https://www.firefoxtours.com/blog/bhutan-tourism-covid-19-faq-constantly-updated

On June 19th, the Prime Minister's office released the below press release. Given the restrictions still in place on gathering sizes, I think a 2G is warranted. As of July 15th, they have issued no further press releases on this topic, so I am assuming the below restrictions are still in effect. I could not find any evidence to the contrary.     ????????????: ???????????????? ???????? ????  • All sports centres – stadiums, gyms, yoga, dance studios, rubber tracks and facilities for traditional games – will reopen.   • No tournaments or spectators will be allowed. Senior citizens are most likely to suffer from serious complications if they contract COVID-19. Here is a TV Spot outlining why senior citizens should stay home during the pandemic from the Ministry of Health. https://web.archive.org/web/20200727150244/https://www.facebook.com/MoHBhutan/posts/3227012864026974

Changes to measures announced on 18th May to be enforced and enforced nationwide with effect from 1st July 2020. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200626230700/http://www.moh.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/ict-files/2020/06/Notification-additional-measures-wef-1st-July-2020.pdf

Testing of symptomatic individuals and regular testing of high-risk communities frontline responders along the border. Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20200626230700/http://www.moh.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/ict-files/2020/06/Notification-additional-measures-wef-1st-July-2020.pdf

There continue to broad relief measures for deferral of tax filings, electricity charges payment for industries, government rental properties deferral extensions.   http://archive.vn/wip/8vu36    http://archive.vn/wip/8vu36

Bhutan has been running the main country awareness through its various websites, but also an official Facebook platform where the residents can get up to date information.   http://archive.vn/wip/MUIbz
Testing is done for those symptomatic, PCR testing is being used, but they are also supplementing with the rapid antibody tests to determine which should be done by PCR.   http://archive.vn/wip/MUIbz
Bhutan has created its own contact tracing app, Druk, allowing them to better monitor and trace contacts with COVID patients.   http://archive.vn/wip/16K76

From 1 July, Students studying in classes X and XII will resume academic sessions. Students studying in classes VII, VIII, IX and XI will resume in the subsequent phases yet to be announced.   Students of Pre-primary and class VI will not undergo campus education for the remainder of academic year.   http://archive.vn/CjGmY

Except for those specified under for later phases, all businesses will resume with extension of closing time from 7pm to 9pm.  • Karaoke, drayangs, night clubs, pubs and movie theaters will be considered in the subsequent phases. Although not the case today, the risk of spread of the disease in these establishments are higher.  • Informalbusinessesandstreetvendorswillbeallowedtooperate.Allvendorsmust wear face masks.  Allsportscentres–stadiums,gyms,yoga,dancestudios,rubbertracksandfacilities for traditional games – will reopen.  • No tournaments or spectators will be allowed. Sports and fitness facilities should ensure minimum attendance at a time. For archery, it will be 15 people. No dancers or onlookers will be allowed.  https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/moving-forward-in-transition-to-a-new-normal/ (cannot archive the link, as it a link to a link)   http://archive.vn/9SvU8

Religious functions and social events like tendrels, birthdays and inaugurals will be limited to family members and close circle of associates. Parks are allowed to open, but huge crowds are discouraged. No tournaments or spectators will be allowed. Sports and fitness facilities should ensure minimum attendance at a time. For archery, it will be 15 people. No dancers or onlookers will be allowed.    As there is no specific number associated with 'huge crowds', I have coded this as a 3 for restrictions on more than 100 people due to the limit of 15 people given for archery.         https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/moving-forward-in-transition-to-a-new-normal/ (cannot archive the link, as it a link to a link)  http://archive.vn/9SvU8

Taxisandotherpublictransportscancarrypassengerstofullseatingcapacity.  • All passengers must use face masks. It is optional for drivers, as it could pose  inconvenience and risks, particularly for long journey.    https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/moving-forward-in-transition-to-a-new-normal/ (cannot archive the link, as it a link to a link)   http://archive.vn/9SvU8
To refrain from going out, people are advised to avail of services that have delivery and are online.  http://archive.vn/9SvU8
As far as we can tell, there has been no internal change to limiting travel within Bhutan of the residents.   http://archive.vn/dNKY0
The government of Bhutan seems to be providing supplementary income to the formal workers depending on their position for at least 30 days.   http://archive.vn/80eSh

In a press release from the Prime Minister's Office on the 19th of June, from the 1st of July:  "Businesses: Informal businesses and street vendors will be allowed to operate. All vendors must wear face masks.  (...) Public Transport: All passengers must use face masks. It is optional for drivers, as it could pose inconvenience and risks, particularly for long journey.  The government encourages using masks at all gatherings. "  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200723013833/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-1-PR_compressed.pdf

According to the guidelines that the ministry of education has published in June, Class X can report to schools on June 29th and class XII on 30th June 2020.However, from Pre-primary to class VI, the school will remain closed for this academic year.  http://archive.vn/CjGmY    http://web.archive.org/web/20200723013833/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-1-PR_compressed.pdf

Starting July 1, 2020, all businesses will resume with the extension of closing time from 7pm to 9pm, except for those specified under for later phases: Karaoke, drayangs, night clubs, pubs and movie theaters.   Informal businesses and street vendors will be allowed to operate.   http://web.archive.org/web/20200723013833/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-1-PR_compressed.pdf

Religious functions and social events are limited to family members and close circle of associates. All religious sites are open. All parks and public places are open. Authorities will monitor and disallow huge gatherings.    The Ministry of Health has published on July 16th guidance for unavoidable mass gathering. The Ministry continues to discourage mass gathering. However, they have provided instructions in unavoidable circumstances where mass gatherings are required.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723022906/http://www.moh.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/ict-files/2020/07/Guidance_UnavoidableMassGathering.pdf    http://web.archive.org/web/20200723013833/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-1-PR_compressed.pdf

Religious functions and social events are limited to family members and close circle of associates. All religious sites are open. All parks and public places are open. Authorities will monitor and disallow huge gatherings.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723013833/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-1-PR_compressed.pdf  "The Ministry of Health continues to discourage mass gathering. However, in unavoidable circumstances where mass gatherings are required, the instructions provided in this document should be enforced.  3. Overall Guidance  1. The gathering venue should have adequate space in proportion to the number of participants 2. Use of open space shall be encouraged for short community gatherings 3. No sick person should attend the gathering 4. Mandatory use of Druk Trace App/Maintain a register for people attending the gathering 5. Mandatory use of face mask throughout the session should be enforced 6. Maintain physical distance (at least 1 meter) at all times 7. Have adequate number of hand washing stations. Where frequent hand washing is not possible, hand sanitizers should be made available 8. Food handlers and servers should use facemask and practice hand hygiene at all times 9. Sharing of utensils and cutleries should be discouraged 10. The organizers should inform about the gathering to respective local government."  Source:  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723022906/http://www.moh.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/ict-files/2020/07/Guidance_UnavoidableMassGathering.pdf

Taxis and other public transports can carry passengers to full seating capacity.  All passengers must use face masks. It is optional for drivers, as it could pose inconvenience and risks, particularly for long journey.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723013833/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-1-PR_compressed.pdf

The guidance detailed in a press release from the Prime Minister's office on the 19th of June remains in place without change:  "To refrain from going out, people are advised to avail of services that have delivery and are online.  (...)   - All government, corporate and private entities are encouraged to opt for virtual meetings and conferences. - Trainings and workshops held in facilities, if not possible online, should limit the number of people and follow COVID norms."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20200723013833/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/06/Phase-1-PR_compressed.pdf

According to a government document published in March, all non-essential and leisure travels within the country are restricted. There is no further evidence that the restriction has been released.  The ministry of health published additional measures to be enforced nationally from July 1st, they highly discourage unnecessary travels between Dzongkhags.    http://archive.vn/dNKY0  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723021010/http://www.moh.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/ict-files/2020/06/Notification-additional-measures-wef-1st-July-2020.pdf

"International flights to and from Bhutan remain severely limited due to travel restrictions on Bhutanese citizens and carriers, as well as border closures. Limited flights resumed between Thailand and Bhutan July 14, though flight schedules are subject to change at short notice."    Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20201106191520/https://www.worldaware.com/critical-alert-bhutan-maintaining-ongoing-covid-19-measures  http://web.archive.org/web/20201106184010/https://www.facebook.com/Drukair/

The Druk Gyalpo’s Relief Kidu for affected individuals will continue from July until September 2020. However, as announced on April 30, 2020, the amounts are revised to Nu 10,000 and Nu 7,000 per month respectively, in anticipation of rising number of applicants.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723012056/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/PR-Phase-2-fiscal-and-monetary-measured.pdf

The prime minister announced the Royal Command to further extend interest waiver for another nine months for loans availed as of April 10, 2020. Full interest waiver shall be granted for another three months from July to September 2020. This will be followed by partial interest waiver (50%) for six additional months from October 2020 to March 2021.  For business continuity, new soft-term bridging loans at a highly concessional interest rate of 5% for businesses will be provided. Micro loans for agriculture and soft loans to CSIs at 2% and 4% interest rates, respectively, will be extended by another 12 months by the National CSI Development Bank.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723012056/https://www.cabinet.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/2020/07/PR-Phase-2-fiscal-and-monetary-measured.pdf

The ministry of health published additional measures to be enforced nationally from July 1st. Including testing of symptomatic individuals. Regular testing of high-risk communities and frontline responders along the border  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723021010/http://www.moh.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/ict-files/2020/06/Notification-additional-measures-wef-1st-July-2020.pdf

The ministry of health published additional measures to be enforced nationally from July 1st, including COVID focal person identification in each sector, fever screening, maintain travel history of all travelers and encouragement of the tracing app.  http://web.archive.org/web/20200723021010/http://www.moh.gov.bt/wp-content/uploads/ict-files/2020/06/Notification-additional-measures-wef-1st-July-2020.pdf
Authorities had allowed some schools to reopen since July 1.

"August 11, 2020  The government announces nationwide lockdown starting today, following report of a COVID-19 positive case in Gelephu, who came in close contact with people in Thimphu, Gelephu, Paro and those along the way.  (...)  All schools, institutions, offices and commercial establishments will remain closed. Ongoing exams will be postponed, while the students and trainees in boarding facilities should continue to remain on campus and follow COVID-19 protocols."  Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201110021322/https://www.facebook.com/PMOBhutan/posts/3146056048840410

"Following report of a COVID-19 positive case in Gelephu, who has come in close contact with people in Thimphu, Gelephu and those along the way, the government announces national lockdown starting today.  No movement of people and vehicles within or beyond Dzongkhags will be allowed unless authorised."  "During lockdown ensure you have supplies of essential items that will last for at least 14 days. Those on long term medication should ensure medicines are refilled for at least one month. If not call 6060. Prepare and maintain essential emergency kits such as torchlights, candles, mosquito nets (in southern districts), facemask etc. (...) Only authorized essential service providers and COVID-19 responders identified by the government will be allowed for movement during the lockdown."  Sources: http://web.archive.org/web/20201106173747/https://www.gov.bt/covid19/11-08-2020-essential-information-on-lockdown/ http://web.archive.org/web/20201106213405/https://twitter.com/pmbhutan/status/1292933626653376513?lang=en

""URGENT NOTICE  August 11, 2020    Following report of a COVID-19 positive case in Gelephu, who has come in close contact with people in Thimphu, Gelephu and those along the way, the government announces national lockdown starting today.    No movement of people and vehicles within or beyond Dzongkhags will be allowed unless authorised." "Bhutan's borders remain closed, including the international airport at Paro. Repatriation flights for stranded nationals have been authorized. However, returning citizens will have to enter a three-week mandatory quarantine."  Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20210320233306/https://www.garda.com/crisis24/news-alerts/367836/bhutan-authorities-impose-nationwide-lockdown-due-to-covid-19-august-11-update-1

"As essential health services are key for the sustenance of life and in an attempt to ease access to such services, the National COVID-19 Task Force today approved a protocol for availing essential health services during lockdowns.  The approved protocol will henceforth be applied during all lockdowns irrespective of their scale and magnitude.  The Ministry of Health urges all Bhutanese to kindly follow the attached protocol for availing the services through the essential health focal points which have been identified for all the 20 districts.  However, please note that everyone availing these services particularly in the health facilities should strictly abide by the following preventive measures:  1. Practice good physical distancing,  2. Wear a face mask at all times and  3. Wash hands frequently with soap and water or use a alcohol based hand rub from time to time."    Source: http://web.archive.org/web/20201107135037/https://www.facebook.com/MoHBhutan/posts/3382997755095150
